column4: can you get take the batteries out and unplug it etc and then try that live usb? THey call it startup disk creator but it makes usb drives

tried all that. The only thing the lap wants to boot from, is its HDD. Under DOS, I'd just put the HDD in a USB enclosure, move it to another machine, SYS it, and move it back into the laptop. It'd probably cry that the drive isn't hibernated anymore, but should run. Unfortunately, I have no DOS handy, and it's NTFS anyway...
the hdd is bootable when connected to a usb post when you change the bios options to boot from usb
I can't enter BIOS on the lappy; it's stuck in the "unhibernate only" mode some laptops now have.
